Overview.Title: Qualify to work on Keypoint tasks
Overview.Text: Object Detection tasks involve marking a center of the objects that belong to specific, listed categories. The categories of interest are "vehicles" that include any of cars, SUVs, cars, Sedan, pickup trucks, station wagon, minivan, Coupe, Microcar, Hatchback, trucks, both small and large trailers (loaded or not loaded) vans, RVs, Motorhomes, camper vans, caravans, popup campers. If you successfully qualify to work on marking keypoint tasks by taking and passing both of the two tests outlined below, you can proceed with next tasks. thank you for the time taken to understand the task in full and to undertake these tests.

To complete a keypoint task, you will use the tools provided to click and mark a point at center of bounding box of each object that belong to listed categories. The general but specific listed categories that we grouped into as "all vehicles" are shown in the task interface to the right of the image. To achieve accurate center of bounding box of the each object in the image, make sure you use the Zoom tool to zoom in and focus on the area of detail. QuestionContent.Title: Understanding categories definitions of objects to be marked

List.ListItem: Refer the categories definitions when deciding appropriate labels : https://mturk-s3-cg.s3.amazonaws.com/Classes-Definitions.pdf Definitions of Classes : Guidelines for each class
Each question contains an image marked with single object. The marked objects in each image need to be labelled to appropriate category from the listed categoreis.
Text description of each category is as follows
"Small" - includes cars, SUVs, cars, Sedan, pickup trucks, station wagon, minivan, Coupe, Microcar, Hatchback
"VanRV" - includes vans, RVs, Motorhomes, camper vans
"Trucks" - includes Large trucks, trucks with attached trailers
"Specialized" - the vehicles such as tractors, plows, balers or any vehicle that has special function such as cement mixing vehicle
"Small trailers" - includes small trailers such as caravans, popup campers
"Large trailers" - trailers that are large -both loaded or unloaded. (relative to adjacent vehicle/objects sizes).
"Unknown" - such as it might just be significant to note it is a vehicle close to one of above classes but not significant enough to classify to a specific vehicle class.
Vehicles that should be marked as "not relevant" if it is a motorbike, motorcyles/bicycles, Golf carts, sprinklers
